title: 8-Day Eastern Uganda Adventure Safari
tagline: Nile Source, Waterfall Abseiling & Murchison Wildlife
description: Uganda's eastern flank is its most exhilarating — a region of roaring rivers, thundering waterfalls, coffee-scented highland villages, and ancient wildlife spectacles. This eight-day adventure takes you from the source of the world's longest river at Jinja, up to the triple cascades of Sipi Falls for white-water rafting and cliff abseiling, then north to Murchison Falls where the entire Nile forces through a seven-metre gap. Add rare white rhino tracking and a canoe hunt for the prehistoric shoebill stork, and you have a safari unlike any other in East Africa.

Ride world-class Grade 3–5 white-water rapids near Jinja
Abseil down the sheer cliff beside a thundering Sipi waterfall

Canoe through Mabamba papyrus swamp in search of the rare shoebill stork

itinerary.title: Arrival in Entebbe
itinerary.description: Touch down at Entebbe International Airport and be met by your Penny Africa Safaris guide with a warm welcome and a cold bottle of water. Transfer to your comfortable guesthouse just minutes from the lake, where the garden birds are already performing in the trees. Tonight is for settling in and good conversation — your guide will walk you through the exciting days ahead over dinner, and the only thing left to do is sleep well.

itinerary.title: Jinja — Source of the Nile
itinerary.description: After a leisurely fruit breakfast, the two-hour drive east to Jinja passes through the lush green corridors of rural Uganda, roadside markets spilling colour across the verges. A boat trip takes you to the exact point where Lake Victoria's waters begin their 6,695-kilometre journey to the Mediterranean — a geographical fact that feels both vast and intimate when you are sitting on the water above it. The afternoon brings a long, wild walk along the Nile's banks, where the current churns over boulders, fishermen balance in dugouts, and the energy of the river is something you can feel in your chest.

itinerary.title: White-Water Rafting & Transfer to Sipi Falls
itinerary.description: The Nile rapids near Jinja are among the best white-water rafting in the world — Grade 4 and 5 waves that will have you laughing and gasping in equal measure. Professional guides handle everything, so you can focus entirely on the rush of cold water, the roar of the next rapid, and the extraordinary fact that you are white-water rafting on the Nile. After a riverside lunch, the afternoon drive climbs east into the foothills of Mount Elgon, the landscape softening from river valley to mountain farmland as Sipi reveals itself at dusk — three waterfalls tumbling down the ancient volcanic slopes, the plains stretching away below.

itinerary.title: Sipi Falls — Abseiling, Hiking & Coffee
itinerary.description: Today is entirely devoted to Sipi Falls and its community. The centrepiece is abseiling — descending face-first alongside the longest of the three falls, the water thundering past as the Karamoja plains open up hundreds of metres below you. Afterwards, a guided hike threads between all three tiers through banana groves, coffee plantations and the red-soiled footpaths of the Sabiny people. Over a cup of locally grown, freshly roasted coffee served by the very farmers who picked the beans, it is hard to imagine a more complete Uganda day.

itinerary.title: Sipi to Murchison Falls National Park
itinerary.description: A long but rewarding drive takes you north-west from Sipi's misty highlands, through the flat agricultural plains of northern Uganda, to the country's largest national park. Stop for lunch in Gulu — a resilient, regenerating city with a warmth that stays with you — before pushing the final three hours west into Murchison Falls National Park. The park's vast savannah stretches to every horizon, dotted with flat-topped acacias silhouetted against an extraordinary African sky.

itinerary.title: Murchison Falls — Game Drive & Victoria Nile Boat Cruise
itinerary.description: Pre-dawn light finds the Murchison savannah at its most alive. The early game drive rolls through open grassland and riverine forest in search of Rothschild giraffes, elephant herds, lions, buffalo, and — with luck — a leopard melting into shade. The afternoon shifts from land to water as you board a boat on the Victoria Nile, drifting upstream past banks lined with Nile crocodiles and enormous hippo pods. The journey ends at the base of Murchison Falls, where the entire Nile forces through a cleft just seven metres wide and plunges forty metres in a curtain of spray, rainbows, and sound that hits you before you see it.

itinerary.title: Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary & Return to Entebbe
itinerary.description: Southern white rhinos were poached to extinction in Uganda by the early 1980s; Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary is the patient, decades-long answer to that loss. Armed rangers guide you on foot through open savannah to where the rhinos graze — close enough that you can hear the grass tearing as they eat and see the prehistoric texture of their hide in full detail. It is a profoundly grounding experience that makes conservation feel both urgent and, here, genuinely hopeful. The afternoon drive south returns you to Entebbe for a final dinner.

itinerary.title: Mabamba Wetland — Shoebill Trekking & Departure
itinerary.description: The shoebill stork looks like a creature that did not get the memo about dinosaurs becoming extinct — five feet tall, with a bill the size and shape of a Dutch clog, and a stare so unwavering it feels like a staring contest you will always lose. Mabamba Swamp, a papyrus labyrinth on Lake Victoria's shore, is one of the best places on earth to find one. A local guide poles you silently through the reeds by dugout canoe until — quite suddenly — a shoebill is simply there, motionless in the shallows, watching you back. After this extraordinary final encounter, transfer to Entebbe International Airport for your departure flight.

seo.metaTitle: 8-Day Eastern Uganda Adventure Safari | Rafting, Sipi Falls & Shoebill | From $2,800
seo.metaDescription: The ultimate eastern Uganda adventure: source of the Nile, white-water rafting, Sipi Falls abseiling, Murchison Falls game drive, white rhino tracking and the rare shoebill stork. All activities included.

faqs.question: Do I need experience for white-water rafting on the Nile?
faqs.answer: None at all. Professional guides provide a full safety briefing and all equipment — helmet, wetsuit and buoyancy aid — before you hit the water. The rapids range from Grade 3 to 5, and guides tailor the run to your comfort level. Tens of thousands of first-timers have rafted the Nile safely; if you can swim and are reasonably fit, you will be absolutely fine.

faqs.question: Is abseiling at Sipi Falls safe for beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes. Sipi's operators use international-standard equipment and experienced local guides who control your descent throughout. You will receive thorough instruction before stepping over the edge. The guides manage the ropes — your job is to lean back, look out at the Karamoja valley, and enjoy it. Most people who arrive nervous leave wanting to go again.

faqs.question: How reliable are shoebill sightings at Mabamba?
faqs.answer: Mabamba Wetland is the best place in Uganda — and one of the best in East Africa — to see the shoebill. While no wildlife sighting can be guaranteed, shoebills are present year-round and are regularly spotted by our guides, who know exactly which channels and reed beds to search. Most guests see one within an hour. Even on rare off-days, the swamp birding (herons, jacanas, kingfishers) is exceptional.

faqs.question: What is the drive to Murchison Falls like — is it very long?
faqs.answer: Day 5 involves around 7–8 hours of driving from Sipi to Murchison Falls. It is a long day, but we break it with a worthwhile lunch stop in Gulu town and the landscapes along the way are genuinely varied and absorbing. The rest of the itinerary is built around activities rather than transit, so this long day is the exception rather than the rule.

faqs.question: Are gorilla permits included in this tour?
faqs.answer: No — this tour is built around eastern Uganda's distinct adventure highlights and does not include gorilla trekking. If you would like to combine these experiences with gorilla trekking, we'd recommend our 9-Day Budget Primate Safari or our 12-Day Spectacular Uganda Safari, both of which include gorilla permits.

faqs.question: Can this tour be extended or customised?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. This itinerary is a popular foundation that we regularly combine with a gorilla trek in Bwindi, an extra day at Sipi, or a few nights in the national parks of western Uganda. Contact us and we'll build the perfect itinerary around your schedule, interests and budget.
